items.title: How A.I. Is Helping Architects Change Workplace Design
items.abstract: With more hybrid workers and new office needs, firms like Zaha Hadid Architects are turning to artificial intelligence for solutions.

items.title: A Hiring Law Blazes a Path for A.I. Regulation
items.abstract: New York City’s pioneering, focused approach sets rules on how companies use the technology in work force decisions.

items.title: A.I. May Help Design Your Favorite Video Game Character
items.abstract: Generative A.I. is already changing how games are made, with Blizzard Entertainment training an image generator on assets from World of Warcraft, Diablo and Overwatch.

items.title: Today’s Scuttlebot: Tech Design Comics and Artificial Intelligence Money
items.abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Thursday, selections include Internet technologies spreading into more industries, which Web sites share what information and the latest iPhone bug.

items.title: Ai Weiwei’s Latest Artwork: Building Fences Throughout New York City
items.abstract: Commissioned by the Public Art Fund, “Good Fences Make Good Neighbors,” an ambitious work about divisive politics and borders, opens on Oct. 12.
